page.title: 06WOODLAND
page.content: The woodlands are an important area for{wildlife}and{wild flowers}as many of the woods have remained undisturbed for centuries.They are also of considerable importance as a{landscape {feature}and for timber.There is good cover for pheasants. Access to the woods is generally by {tracks and footpaths.}The{soil}is derived from the{chalk}of the {Hampshire}basin,predominately{clay with{flints}of good depth except on middle slopes where the depth is insufficient to support certain trees.Drainage is good. { Oak}with{hazel coppice}is the main species in the broadleaved woodlands with{ash,beech}and{birch}as well.In the past the{oak}may well have been used for{charcoal}or as a source of bark for local tanneries.
